meanings.definition: To subject (organic matter) to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen, resulting in chemical changes.
meanings.sent1: I will pyrolyse the wood to make charcoal for our barbecue.
meanings.sent2: Scientists pyrolyse biomass to produce biochar for agricultural use.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to pyrolyse the sugar to create a unique caramel sauce.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to pyrolyse the very essence of the old building.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire's heat was so intense, it could pyrolyse entire trees in seconds.

meanings.definition: The process of heating organic matter in the absence of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: Pyrolyse is an important step in the production of biofuels.
meanings.sent2: During pyrolyse, organic materials break down into different components.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the teacher explained pyrolyse with a baking analogy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity seemed to go through a pyrolyse, transforming into something entirely new.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization's rituals involved a form of pyrolyse to honor their ancestors.
